answers.answer: Hello,your numbers are mostly (except last October 2012), within the laboratories' ranges.  However, truly normal fasting will be < 90.So I would say that your n umbers show slight impairment.  Definitely worthwhile for you to keep monitoring.  Have you had Hba1c tested?  This is an average 3 months blood sugars.  Truly normal is in the range of 4.4 - 5,0.Please consider that you are at risk for diabetes and it is best if you already adopt a lower carb diet, get regular (ideally daily) exercise, and make sure your weight is normal / ideal.

question: do I have impaired glucose fasting (IGF) based on the following results?TEST ( October 29, 2012):glucose (glusoce-tube): 142 mg/dL,, range(74-106)TEST (April 22, 2013):glucose : 98 mg/dL,, range(74-106)TEST (January 07, 2014):glucose (fasting) : 92 mg/dL,, range(<100)TEST (May 26, 2014):glucose : 100 mg/dL,, range(74-106)I will be happy for feedback.
title: do I have impaired glucose fasting (IGF) based on the following results?
